title.justification: The title succinctly describes the core contribution of the paper, which is the proposal of the Latent Bottlenecked Attentive Neural Processes (LBANPs).
title.quote: L ATENT B OTTLENECKED ATTENTIVE N EURAL P ROCESSES

extractions.description: The paper introduces Latent Bottlenecked Attentive Neural Processes (LBANPs), a novel meta-learning model that addresses the high computational complexity of previous state-of-the-art Neural Processes (NPs) by encoding context datasets into a constant number of latent vectors and utilizing self-attention. The proposed method achieves competitive results while significantly improving scalability and efficiency.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental data and empirical evaluations to demonstrate the effectiveness and efficiency of the proposed LBANPs model.
type.quote: We empirically show that LBANPs achieve results competitive with the state-of-the-art on meta-regression, image completion, and contextual multi-armed bandits.

name.justification: The paper focuses on Neural Processes (NPs) which are a popular method in meta-learning to estimate predictive uncertainty by conditioning on a context dataset.
name.quote: Neural Processes (NPs) are popular methods in meta-learning that can estimate predictive uncertainty on target datapoints by conditioning on a context dataset.

name.justification: The primary contribution of the paper is the introduction of Latent Bottlenecked Attentive Neural Processes (LBANPs), enhancing existing NP models.
name.quote: We propose Latent Bottlenecked Attentive Neural Processes (LBANP), a new computationally efficient sub-quadratic NP variant.

name.justification: The paper introduces enhancements in attention mechanisms such as cross-attention and self-attention in the context of Neural Processes.
name.quote: The model encodes the context dataset into a fixed number of latent vectors on which self-attention is performed. When making predictions, the model retrieves higher-order information from the context dataset via multiple cross-attention mechanisms on the latent vectors.

name.justification: One of the application domains of LBANPs demonstrated in the paper is image completion.
name.quote: We empirically show that LBANPs achieve results competitive with the state-of-the-art on meta-regression, image completion, and contextual multi-armed bandits.

name.justification: The model's performance is evaluated in the domain of contextual multi-armed bandits.
name.quote: We empirically show that LBANPs achieve results competitive with the state-of-the-art on meta-regression, image completion, and contextual multi-armed bandits.

name.justification: The paper proposes LBANPs as a new, computationally efficient NP variant.
name.quote: We propose Latent Bottlenecked Attentive Neural Processes (LBANP), a new computationally efficient sub-quadratic NP variant.

is_contributed.justification: The model is the primary contribution of the research paper.
is_contributed.quote: We propose Latent Bottlenecked Attentive Neural Processes (LBANP), a new computationally efficient sub-quadratic NP variant.

is_executed.justification: The model was run in multiple experimental settings, including meta-regression and image completion.
is_executed.quote: We empirically show that LBANPs achieve results competitive with the state-of-the-art on meta-regression, image completion, and contextual multi-armed bandits.

is_compared.justification: The model's performance was compared with other state-of-the-art NP variants in various tasks.
is_compared.quote: We empirically show that LBANPs achieve results competitive with the state-of-the-art on meta-regression, image completion, and contextual multi-armed bandits.

referenced_paper_title.justification: LBANPs is an original contribution and not based on a previous model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We propose Latent Bottlenecked Attentive Neural Processes (LBANP), a new computationally efficient sub-quadratic NP variant.

name.justification: TNPs are mentioned multiple times as a baseline and a state-of-the-art NP variant for comparison.

is_contributed.justification: The paper uses TNPs for comparison but does not contribute it.
is_contributed.quote: In contrast, recent state-of-the-art methods have proposed to use self-attention mechanisms such as transformers. However, these state-of-the-art methods are computationally expensive in that they require quadratic computation in the number of context datapoints.

is_executed.justification: The paper mentioned TNPs for comparison purposes but did not detail executing the model.
is_executed.quote: TNP-D uses significantly more memory than LBANPs when making predictions.

is_compared.justification: TNPs were used as a baseline to compare the performance and efficiency of LBANPs.
is_compared.quote: In contrast, recent state-of-the-art methods have proposed to use self-attention mechanisms such as transformers. However, these state-of-the-art methods are computationally expensive in that they require quadratic computation in the number of context datapoints.

referenced_paper_title.value: Transformer Neural Processes: Uncertainty-Aware Meta Learning via Sequence Modeling
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper provides the full title of the referenced TNPs paper for comparison.

name.justification: The EQTNPs model was introduced as an intermediary step towards developing LBANPs and was empirically evaluated.
name.quote: Figure 1 describes how the architecture of TNP is modified to give a more efficient variant that we name Efficient Queries TNPs (EQTNPs).

is_contributed.justification: The paper contributes EQTNPs as an efficient modification of TNPs.
is_contributed.quote: Figure 1 describes how the architecture of TNP is modified to give a more efficient variant that we name Efficient Queries TNPs (EQTNPs).

is_executed.justification: The model was run in multiple experimental settings, including meta-regression and image completion.
is_executed.quote: We compare LBANPs with the following members of the NP family:...and Transformer Neural Processes (TNPs) (Nguyen & Grover, 2022). In addition, we compare with their attentive variants (Kim et al., 2019) (CANPs, ANPs, and BANPs).

is_compared.justification: LBANPs are directly compared with EQTNPs.
is_compared.quote: EQTNPs are more efficient than TNPs, they unfortunately still require quadratic computation to compute the embeddings of the context dataset, limiting its applications.

referenced_paper_title.justification: EQTNPs is an original contribution within the same paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Figure 1 describes how the architecture of TNP is modified to give a more efficient variant that we name Efficient Queries TNPs (EQTNPs).

name.justification: The paper uses the EMNIST dataset for evaluating image completion tasks.
name.quote: For these experiments, we consider two datasets: EMNIST (Cohen et al., 2017) and CelebA (Liu et al., 2015).

referenced_paper_title.value: EMNIST: Extending MNIST to Handwritten Letters
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is cited with its reference for clear attribution.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For these experiments, we consider two datasets: EMNIST (Cohen et al., 2017) and CelebA (Liu et al., 2015).

name.justification: The paper uses the CelebA dataset for evaluating image completion tasks.
name.quote: For these experiments, we consider two datasets: EMNIST (Cohen et al., 2017) and CelebA (Liu et al., 2015).

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Learning Face Attributes in the Wild
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is cited with its reference for clear attribution.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For these experiments, we consider two datasets: EMNIST (Cohen et al., 2017) and CelebA (Liu et al., 2015).

name.justification: The experiments, including the implementation of LBANPs and baselines, were conducted using PyTorch.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The library is commonly known and used, hence does not require a specific reference paper.
